translated: The Elders’ Birth Stories🔽The Chapter about the Giver of a Support

analyzed: dvi rata niyat theḥ a padāna

translated: “In the past I was a hunter
A piece of meat was given by me
In the world with its gods
a jewel was produced for me;
These two jewels in the world
are for the attainment of the visible here and now.
by the power of the gift of meat;🔽My body is soft
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the gift of meat.
I was a lord of the people;
… the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā dverataniyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai dverataniyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus did the Elder Dveratani recite these verses.
This is the story of the Elder Dveratānīya.
